DataElement.preferredName: Gynecologic Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Or Metastatic Diagnosis Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to Information regarding the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease of a gynecologic tumor composed of atypical neoplastic that is either recurrent or has spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gynecologic Malignant Neoplasm Recurrent Or Metastatic Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease of a gynecologic tumor composed of atypical neoplastic that is either recurrent or has spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to or practicing gynecology; pertaining to the health issues of women.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: occurring again.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: released as part of draft content review;SD 12/21/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have persist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have persistent, recurrent, or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma or adenocarcinoma of the cervix with documented disease progression (disease not amendable to curative therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have carcinoma in situ of the cervix?
